page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: It is bordered to the south by the River Thames,to the east by the area known as West Thurrock,to the north by the new A13 dual carriageway with interchange to the M25 motorway,and to the west by part of the village of Purfleet. It incorporates some of the industrial area that runs along the banks of the Thames,ranging from light industry to petroleum storage,river berths and a large power station. Much of the area is disused chalk quarries,some of which are being redeveloped for industry and recreation,others are in various stages of natural colonisation.There is talk of siting a new town within some of these quarries,complete with a new railway station. The northern area has some agricultural usage,mainly pastural.
